tr.td: Struts Kick Start by James Turner and Kevin Bedell - December 2002. [Sample chapter available]
Programming Jakarta Struts by Chuck Cavaness. November 2002. [beta chapter available]
The Struts Framework: Practical Guide for Programmers by Sue Spielman. November 2002.

Struts in Action by Ted Husted, Cedric Dumoulin, George Franciscus, and David Winterfeldt; Foreword by Craig R. McClanahan. November 2002. [sample chapters available] (formerly known as "Java Web Development with Struts")
Mastering Jakarta Struts by James Goodwill. August 2002. [excerpt available]
Struts Fast Track: J2EE / JSP Framework by Victor Cekvenich - Practical Application with Database Access and Struts Extensions. November 2001.

section.name: Books with Struts coverage
section.p: JSP and Tag Libraries for Web Development - by Wellington L. S. Da Silva. January 2002. Several chapters regarding Struts.

Professional JSP Site Design - Wrox book by Husted, Kunnumpurath, Lavandowska, Panduranga, et al. November 2001. Features Struts in chapters 2 (The Struts Framework), 6 (Navigation), 8 (Data Access Patterns), 12 (Content Management), 13 (Searching), and 14 (Portals).
Websphere Version 4 Application Development Handbook (PDF) - Chapter 7 covers designing with both the Struts and Websphere frameworks.
Java Server Pages and J2EE Web-based Applications for Enterprises - In German, with a Chapter regarding MVC and Struts.
Core J2EE Patterns - Many of these patterns are deployed in Struts.
Professional JSP 2nd Edition - Wrox book - long chapter on Struts.
Advanced JavaServer Pages by David Geary - Features template tag library from Struts 1.0.
MySQL and JSP Web Applications: Data-Driven Programming Using Tomcat and MySQL by James Turner - Includes a chapter on Tomcat and Struts.
